## Beta of a Three‑Asset Portfolio ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} set.seed(303) #| eval: true #| echo: false #| results: asis #| warning: false library(webexercises) # Random weights for three assets (ensure they sum to 1) w1 <- runif(1, 0, 1) w2 <- runif(1, 0, 1 - w1) w3 <- 1 - w1 - w2 # Random betas for each asset beta1 <- rnorm(1, mean = 0.8, sd = 0.2) beta2 <- rnorm(1, mean = 1.2, sd = 0.3) beta3 <- rnorm(1, mean = 0.5, sd = 0.2) beta_port <- w1 * beta1 + w2 * beta2 + w3 * beta3 ``` ::: You hold a portfolio composed of three assets with betas **0.86**, **1.32**, and **0.51**, invested in proportions **30.96%**, **57.62%**, and **11.42%**, respectively. ::: {.question-block}
✅ Portfolio beta = w₁×β₁ + w₂×β₂ + w₃×β₃ = **1.08**.
:::
